metadata.title: Intermediate Week 1 — Monday (Day 1)
keyFeatures: Baseline volume (12-14 sets chest, 10-12 shoulders, 6-8 triceps)

structuredWorkout.title: Push: Chest & Shoulders
structuredWorkout.description: Welcome to your first Push day in the PPL split. Focus on horizontal and vertical pressing with chest and front delt priority. Start conservatively (RPE 7-8) to establish your baseline—leave 2-3 reps in reserve on all sets. Track every lift: weight, reps, RPE.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Prepare shoulders, chest, and CNS for pressing

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Walk, bike, or row — conversational pace

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.notes: Forward and backward — loosen shoulder joints

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.notes: Activate rear delts and scapular retractors (balance pushing work)

exercises.name: Scapular Push-Ups
exercises.notes: Protract and retract shoulder blades while in push-up position — teaches scapular control

sections.title: Compounds
sections.overview: Main pressing strength movements — 3-4 sets of 6-10 reps @ RPE 7-8

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press

intensity.description: Your main pressing strength movement — start conservatively (70-75% estimated 1RM)

exercises.notes: Focus: Full ROM (bar to chest), controlled descent, explosive press. Leave 2-3 reps in reserve. Track weight used.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press

intensity.description: Upper chest focus — control the descent

exercises.notes: Focus: 30-45° incline, elbows ~45° from body, squeeze dumbbells together at top without touching. Feel upper chest working.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press

intensity.description: Front delt emphasis — strict form, no leg drive

exercises.notes: Focus: Start at shoulder height, press to full lockout overhead, control descent. Keep core tight, no excessive arch.

sections.title: Accessories
sections.overview: Volume work with moderate intensity — 3 sets of 10-15 reps @ RPE 8

exercises.name: Machine Chest Press

intensity.description: Machine allows pushing without stability demands — can focus purely on contraction

exercises.notes: Alternative: Dips 3x8-12 @ RPE 8 (use assistance machine if needed to hit rep range). Focus: Squeeze chest at contraction, control the negative.

sections.title: Isolation
sections.overview: Isolation work for side delts and triceps — 2-3 sets of 12-20 reps @ RPE 8-9

exercises.name: Lateral Raises

intensity.description: Side delts — lighter weight, control the descent, don't swing

exercises.notes: Focus: Lead with elbows, raise to shoulder height, control the descent (3sec). Don't use momentum. Stop if you start swinging.

exercises.name: Overhead Triceps Extension

intensity.description: Triceps are pre-fatigued from pressing — this is accessory volume

exercises.notes: Alternative: Skull Crushers 3x12-15 @ RPE 8. Focus: Keep elbows stationary, full stretch at bottom, full contraction at top.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Static stretching and recovery

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Chest stretch (doorway or corner), shoulder stretch (cross-body), triceps stretch — hold each 30s per side

structuredWorkout.title: Pull: Back & Biceps
structuredWorkout.description: First Pull day of the week. Focus on vertical and horizontal pulling with back width/thickness balance. Deadlift is your main posterior chain movement—prioritize form and speed, don't grind reps. Leave 2-3 RIR on all sets.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Prepare back, posterior chain, and grip

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Walk, bike, or row

exercises.notes: Rowing is ideal for Pull day — primes pulling muscles

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.notes: Activate upper back and rear delts — focus on scapular retraction

exercises.name: Scapular Retractions
exercises.notes: Hang from pull-up bar or use lat pulldown — retract and protract shoulder blades without pulling

exercises.name: Light Deadlift Warm-Up

intensity.description: Empty bar or 95lbs

exercises.notes: Prime deadlift movement pattern — focus on hip hinge, neutral spine

sections.title: Compounds
sections.overview: Main pulling strength movements — 3-4 sets of 6-10 reps @ RPE 7-8

exercises.name: Conventional Deadlift

intensity.description: Main posterior chain movement — focus on form and speed, don't grind reps

exercises.notes: Setup: Feet hip-width, bar over mid-foot, neutral spine, push floor away. Speed matters more than max weight in accumulation. Track weight.

exercises.name: Pull-Ups

intensity.description: Back width — focus on pulling elbows down, not hands

exercises.notes: Alternative: Lat Pulldown 4x8-10 @ RPE 7-8 (use if you can't hit 8-10 pull-ups). Use assistance machine if needed to stay in rep range. Focus: Full stretch at bottom, pull elbows to ribs.

exercises.name: Barbell Row

intensity.description: Back thickness — pull to sternum, squeeze shoulder blades together

exercises.notes: Alternative: Chest-Supported Row 3x10-12 @ RPE 7-8 (removes lower back fatigue from deadlift). Focus: Row to lower chest/sternum, 1sec squeeze at top.

sections.title: Accessories
sections.overview: Unilateral and rear delt work — 3 sets of 12-20 reps @ RPE 8

exercises.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row

intensity.description: Unilateral work for balance and stretch — each arm

exercises.notes: Setup: Knee and hand on bench, torso parallel to floor. Pull dumbbell to hip, focus on lat stretch at bottom and contraction at top.

exercises.name: Face Pulls

intensity.description: Rear delts and upper back health — control the contraction

exercises.notes: Setup: Rope attachment at face height. Pull to face, elbows high, external rotation at end. Squeeze rear delts and upper traps.

sections.title: Isolation
sections.overview: Biceps work — 3 sets of 10-15 reps @ RPE 8

exercises.name: Barbell Curls

intensity.description: Biceps mass builder — strict form, no swinging

exercises.notes: Focus: Elbows stationary, control the descent (3sec), squeeze at top. If you start swinging, reduce weight.

exercises.name: Hammer Curls

intensity.description: Brachialis and forearm — complements barbell curls

exercises.notes: Focus: Neutral grip (palms facing each other), curl dumbbells without rotating wrists. Builds forearm thickness.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Static stretching and recovery

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Lat stretch (hang from bar or doorway), biceps stretch (extend arm against wall), forearm stretch — hold each 30s per side

metadata.title: Intermediate Week 1 — Wednesday (Day 3)
keyFeatures: Baseline volume (14-16 sets quads, 6-8 hamstrings/glutes, 4-6 calves)
Squat with tempo emphasis (3sec descent, 1sec pause, explosive up)

structuredWorkout.title: Legs: Quad Emphasis
structuredWorkout.description: First Leg day of the week with quad emphasis. Squat is your main leg developer—focus on depth and tempo (3sec descent, 1sec pause, explosive up). Balance with hamstring and calf work. Leave 2-3 RIR on all sets.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Prepare hips, knees, and ankles for loaded squatting

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Walk, bike, or light jog

exercises.notes: Get blood flowing to lower body — bike is ideal (no impact, quad activation)

exercises.name: Leg Swings
exercises.notes: Front-to-back and side-to-side — loosen hip flexors and adductors

exercises.name: Bodyweight Squats
exercises.notes: Focus on depth and upright torso — prime the squat pattern

exercises.name: Ankle Mobility
exercises.notes: Ankle circles and dorsiflexion stretches — each leg. Good ankle mobility = better squat depth.

sections.title: Compounds
sections.overview: Main quad/leg developers — 3-4 sets of 8-15 reps @ RPE 7-8

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat

intensity.description: Main quad/leg developer — focus on depth and tempo

exercises.notes: Tempo: 3sec descent, 1sec pause at bottom, explosive up. Setup: Bar on traps (high bar) or rear delts (low bar), feet shoulder-width. Depth to parallel or below. Track weight.

exercises.name: Leg Press

intensity.description: High volume quad work — push through heels, full ROM

exercises.notes: Focus: Feet shoulder-width and high on platform (glute involvement), control descent to 90°, explode up. Don't bounce at bottom.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat

intensity.description: Unilateral quad/glute work — control the descent, front leg does the work (each leg)

exercises.notes: Setup: Rear foot elevated on bench, front foot 2-3 feet forward. Lower until front thigh is parallel, drive through front heel. Use dumbbells or bodyweight.

sections.title: Isolation
sections.overview: Quad and hamstring isolation — 3 sets of 12-20 reps @ RPE 8-9

exercises.name: Leg Extensions

intensity.description: Quad isolation — control the eccentric, squeeze at top

exercises.notes: Focus: Control the descent (3sec), squeeze quads hard at full extension. Don't lock knees violently at top.

exercises.name: Leg Curls

intensity.description: Hamstring isolation — complements RDL

exercises.notes: Focus: Lying or seated version, control the descent, squeeze hamstrings at full contraction. Don't use momentum.

sections.title: Accessories
sections.overview: Hamstring stretch/load and calf work

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift

intensity.description: Hamstring stretch and load — lighter than conventional DL, focus on eccentric

exercises.notes: Focus: Soft knees, push hips back, feel hamstring stretch. Control the descent (3sec), drive hips forward to stand. Don't round your back.

exercises.name: Calf Raises

intensity.description: Standing or seated — full stretch at bottom, full contraction at top

exercises.notes: Focus: Full ROM (heel drop below toes at bottom, full plantarflexion at top). Pause 1sec at top. Use standing for gastrocnemius, seated for soleus.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Stretching and foam rolling (optional)

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Quad stretch (pull foot to glute), hamstring stretch (toe touch), hip flexor stretch (lunge position) — hold each 30s per side

exercises.name: Foam Rolling

intensity.description: Optional

exercises.notes: If available: Roll quads, hamstrings, IT band, calves — 30-60sec per muscle. Stop on tender spots and breathe.

structuredWorkout.title: Push: Triceps & Front Delts (DELOAD)
structuredWorkout.description: Second Push day of the deload week. Cut all sets in half, use 70-80% of Week 6 working weights, keep intensity at RPE 6-7. This is ACTIVE recovery—don't skip the gym, but don't push hard either. You should feel strong and controlled, not fatigued. Session time ~40-50min.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Still important—prepare joints and CNS even during deload

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Walk, bike, or row — conversational pace

exercises.notes: Keep it light—just prime the body, no need for extended warm-up

exercises.name: Arm Circles
exercises.notes: Forward and backward — loosen shoulders

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.notes: Activate rear delts and scapular retractors

sections.title: Compounds (DELOAD)
sections.overview: 2 sets instead of 4 — 70-80% of Week 6 loads, RPE 6-7

exercises.name: Incline Barbell Press

intensity.description: Upper chest — 70-80% of Week 6 working weight

exercises.notes: If you used 155lbs in Week 6, use ~115-125lbs today. Focus: Smooth reps, no grinding. Should feel crisp and controlled.

exercises.name: Flat Dumbbell Press

intensity.description: Chest thickness — control the movement, no grinding

exercises.notes: Lighter dumbbells than Week 6. Focus: Full ROM, squeeze at top. Leave 3-4 reps in reserve.

exercises.name: Seated Dumbbell Shoulder Press

intensity.description: Front/side delts — strict form, lighter weight

exercises.notes: Focus: Press to full lockout, control descent. Should feel easy compared to accumulation weeks.

exercises.name: Close-Grip Bench Press

intensity.description: Triceps mass builder — elbows tucked, lighter load

exercises.notes: Focus: Elbows close to body, smooth tempo. This should feel restorative, not taxing.

sections.title: Isolation (DELOAD)
sections.overview: 2 sets instead of 3 — lighter loads, RPE 7 max

exercises.name: Cable Flyes

intensity.description: Chest isolation — stretch at bottom, squeeze at contraction

exercises.notes: Focus: Controlled movement, feel the stretch. Don't push to failure—stop at 12-15 with reps left.

exercises.name: Front Raises

intensity.description: Front delt isolation — lighter weight, perfect form

exercises.notes: Focus: Lead with thumbs, raise to shoulder height. No swinging—strict form.

exercises.name: Triceps Pushdowns

intensity.description: Triceps isolation — keep elbows stationary, full extension

exercises.notes: Focus: Squeeze triceps at bottom, control the return. Should feel like a pump, not a grind.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Brief stretching and recovery

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Chest stretch (doorway), shoulder stretch, triceps stretch — hold each 30s per side

structuredWorkout.title: Pull: Rear Delts & Biceps (DELOAD)
structuredWorkout.description: Second Pull day of the deload week. Cut sets in half, use 70-80% of Week 6 weights, RPE 6-7. Focus on quality reps—smooth and controlled. No deadlift today (posterior chain gets extra rest). Session time ~40-50min.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Light prep for pulling movements

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Rowing is ideal — primes pulling muscles

exercises.notes: Keep it easy—conversational pace throughout

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.notes: Activate upper back and rear delts

exercises.name: Scapular Retractions
exercises.notes: Hang from pull-up bar or use lat pulldown — retract and protract shoulder blades

sections.title: Compounds (DELOAD)
sections.overview: 2 sets instead of 4 — 70-80% loads, RPE 6-7

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-Ups

intensity.description: Back width — focus on quality reps

exercises.notes: Alternative: Lat Pulldown 2x8-10 @ RPE 6-7 (lighter weight than accumulation weeks). Focus: Smooth reps, full stretch at top, pull elbows down.

exercises.name: T-Bar Row

intensity.description: Back thickness — controlled pull and descent

exercises.notes: Alternative: Pendlay Row 2x10-12 @ RPE 6-7. Focus: Pull to lower chest, squeeze at top, control the descent. Lighter than Week 6.

exercises.name: Seated Cable Row

intensity.description: Mid-back — squeeze at contraction, feel the stretch

exercises.notes: Focus: Full stretch at extension, squeeze shoulder blades together. Should feel easy—don't push to failure.

sections.title: Isolation (DELOAD)
sections.overview: 2 sets instead of 3-4 — lighter loads, RPE 7 max

exercises.name: Straight-Arm Pulldown

intensity.description: Lat isolation — keep arms straight, pull with lats

exercises.notes: Focus: Feel lats contracting, not arms. Light weight, controlled movement.

exercises.name: Reverse Pec Deck

intensity.description: Rear delt priority — control the movement

exercises.notes: Alternative: Rear Delt Flyes 2x15-20 @ RPE 7. Focus: Squeeze rear delts, control the return. Lighter than accumulation weeks.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Curls

intensity.description: Biceps stretch at bottom, squeeze at top

exercises.notes: Focus: Full stretch at bottom (arms fully extended), squeeze biceps at top. Lighter weight than Week 6.

exercises.name: Cable Curls

intensity.description: Biceps pump — constant tension

exercises.notes: Focus: Squeeze biceps at contraction, control the descent. Should feel like a pump, not a burn.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Brief stretching and recovery

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Lat stretch (hang from bar or doorway), biceps stretch (extend arm against wall), forearm stretch — hold each 30s

metadata.title: Intermediate Week 7 — Saturday (Day 6) DELOAD
keyFeatures: RPE 6-7 (lighter load, focus on stretch and control)
No heavy squatting (legs get extra rest)

structuredWorkout.title: Legs: Hamstring & Glute Emphasis (DELOAD)
structuredWorkout.description: Second Leg day of the deload week, completing your 6-day PPL cycle. Cut sets in half, use 70-80% of Week 6 weights, RPE 6-7. Focus on hamstring stretch and glute activation—not maximal load. Legs should feel fresh after this session. This completes your deload week—you should feel significantly fresher than Week 6.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Light prep for hip-dominant work

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Walk or bike — no impact needed

exercises.notes: Keep it light—just get blood flowing to lower body

exercises.name: Hip Mobility
exercises.notes: Leg swings (front-to-back and side-to-side) — loosen hips

exercises.name: Glute Activation
exercises.notes: Banded glute bridges or clamshells — activate glutes before loading

sections.title: Compounds (DELOAD)
sections.overview: 2 sets instead of 4 — 70-80% loads, RPE 6-7

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift

intensity.description: Hamstring stretch and load — lighter load, focus on hamstring stretch and control

exercises.notes: If you used 185lbs in Week 6, use ~135-155lbs today. Focus: Hip hinge, feel hamstring stretch, control the descent (3sec). No grinding.

exercises.name: Hip Thrusts

intensity.description: Glute activation — not maximal load

exercises.notes: Focus: Squeeze glutes hard at top, full ROM. Barbell or Smith machine, lighter than accumulation weeks. Should feel easy.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges

intensity.description: Quad/glute work — control the descent (each leg)

exercises.notes: Bodyweight or light dumbbells. Focus: Control the descent, drive through front heel. Should feel smooth and controlled.

sections.title: Isolation (DELOAD)
sections.overview: 2 sets instead of 3 — lighter loads, RPE 7 max

exercises.name: Lying Leg Curls

intensity.description: Hamstring isolation — lighter weight

exercises.notes: Focus: Control the descent, squeeze hamstrings at contraction. Don't push to failure—stop at 12-15 with reps left.

exercises.name: Leg Press (Narrow Stance)

intensity.description: Glute emphasis with narrow stance — moderate load

exercises.notes: Focus: Feet high and narrow on platform (glute emphasis), control descent to 90°, drive through heels.

exercises.name: Seated Calf Raises

intensity.description: Soleus emphasis — full ROM

exercises.notes: Focus: Full stretch at bottom, full contraction at top, pause 1sec. Lighter than accumulation weeks.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Stretching and recovery — deload week complete!

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Hamstring stretch (toe touch), quad stretch (pull foot to glute), hip flexor stretch (lunge position), calf stretch — hold each 30s per side

metadata.title: Intermediate Week 13 — Monday (Day 1) INTENSIFICATION
keyFeatures: Rest-pause on bench press final set

structuredWorkout.title: Push: Chest & Shoulders (INTENSIFICATION)
structuredWorkout.description: Peak intensification week. RPE 8-9 across the board with advanced techniques deployed: rest-pause on bench press, slow eccentrics on incline press, drop set on lateral raises. This creates mechanical tension, metabolic stress, and muscle damage—the three drivers of hypertrophy. Push intelligently, not recklessly. Form is still king.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Thorough prep for heavy pressing + CNS activation

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Walk, bike, or row — conversational pace

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate and body temperature

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.notes: Activate rear delts and scapular retractors — balance heavy pressing

exercises.name: Light Pressing

intensity.description: Empty bar or light dumbbells

exercises.notes: Prime pressing pattern — 1 set bench press, 1 set shoulder press with bar/light DBs

sections.title: Compounds (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Heavy pressing with advanced techniques — 3-4 sets of 6-10 reps @ RPE 8-9

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press

intensity.description: Heavy weight — if you can do 9 reps, weight is too light

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, hit 6 reps → rack bar → rest 15-20sec → squeeze out 2-3 more reps (REST-PAUSE). This pushes beyond standard failure. Focus: Bar to chest, explosive press, don't grind reps 1-3 (save energy for rest-pause). Track weight.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press

intensity.description: Upper chest focus — control the descent

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, use 4-5sec eccentric (descent) on EVERY rep. This increases time under tension dramatically. You may need to drop reps to 6-8 due to fatigue — that's expected. Focus: Feel the stretch, control the weight, don't let it drop.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press

intensity.description: Heavy, controlled, no leg drive — pure shoulder strength

exercises.notes: Focus: Start at shoulder height, press to full lockout, control descent. Keep core tight, no excessive arch. This should feel HEAVY.

sections.title: Accessories (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: High volume with strict execution — 3 sets of 10-12 reps @ RPE 8-9

exercises.name: Machine Chest Press

intensity.description: Strict form, squeeze at contraction — no advanced techniques, just straight sets close to failure

exercises.notes: Focus: Push to near failure (1-2 reps left), squeeze chest at contraction, control the return. No rest-pause here — save that for compounds.

sections.title: Isolation (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Metabolic stress and pump — 3 sets of 10-15 reps @ RPE 9

exercises.name: Lateral Raises

intensity.description: Side delts — lighter weight, control the descent

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, after hitting failure at 12-15 reps → drop weight by 30-40% → IMMEDIATELY continue for another 8-10 reps (DROP SET for metabolic stress). Expect intense burn. Focus: Lead with elbows, no swinging, strict form even when burning.

exercises.name: Overhead Triceps Extension

intensity.description: Triceps are pre-fatigued from pressing — even moderate weight will feel heavy

exercises.notes: Focus: Keep elbows stationary, full stretch at bottom, full contraction at top. Don't let elbows flare out. Take to near failure (1-2 reps left).

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Stretching and foam rolling — recovery is critical at this intensity

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Chest stretch (doorway), shoulder stretch, triceps stretch — hold each 30s per side. Add light foam rolling if available (chest, shoulders, triceps).

structuredWorkout.title: Pull: Back & Biceps (INTENSIFICATION)
structuredWorkout.description: Peak intensification week. Advanced techniques deployed: rest-pause on deadlift, slow eccentrics on pull-ups/pulldowns, drop set on barbell curls. Form is CRITICAL on deadlift rest-pause—don't round your back chasing reps. This is brutal but effective. Expect significant back pump and fatigue.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Thorough prep for heavy deadlifts and pulling

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Rowing is ideal — primes pulling muscles

exercises.notes: Gradually elevate heart rate

exercises.name: Band Pull-Aparts
exercises.notes: Activate upper back and rear delts

exercises.name: Scapular Work
exercises.notes: Scapular retractions and depressions — hang from bar or use lat pulldown machine

exercises.name: Light Deadlift Warm-Up

intensity.description: Bar, 95lbs, 135lbs progression

exercises.notes: Prime deadlift pattern — focus on hip hinge, neutral spine. Work up gradually to working weight.

sections.title: Compounds (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Heavy pulling with advanced techniques — 3-4 sets of 5-10 reps @ RPE 8-9

exercises.name: Conventional Deadlift

intensity.description: Heavy deadlifts — form is CRITICAL

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, hit 5 reps → rest 20-30sec (bar on floor) → grind out 1-2 more reps (REST-PAUSE). Form is CRITICAL — don't round your back chasing reps. If form breaks down, stop immediately. Focus: Neutral spine, push floor away, hips and shoulders rise together.

exercises.name: Weighted Pull-Ups

intensity.description: Back width — add weight if doing pull-ups, go heavy if lat pulldown

exercises.notes: Alternative: Lat Pulldown 4x6-8 @ RPE 8-9. ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, add 4-5sec eccentric (descent) on EVERY rep. Control the descent, feel the lat stretch. This is brutal but effective for time under tension. You may need assistance for final reps—that's okay.

exercises.name: Barbell Row

intensity.description: Back thickness — explosive concentric, controlled eccentric, squeeze at top

exercises.notes: Focus: Bent-over position, pull to sternum/lower chest, 1sec squeeze at top. Don't use momentum—strict form. Heavy weight.

sections.title: Accessories (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Unilateral and rear delt work — 3 sets of 10-20 reps @ RPE 8-9

exercises.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row

intensity.description: Unilateral work allows full ROM and stretch — go heavy (each arm)

exercises.notes: Focus: Pull dumbbell to hip, full stretch at bottom, squeeze at top. Use heavy weight—this is strength work, not pump work.

exercises.name: Face Pulls

intensity.description: Rear delt health and hypertrophy — don't skip this

exercises.notes: Focus: Pull to face, elbows high, external rotation at end. Squeeze rear delts hard. Critical for shoulder health with all the pressing.

sections.title: Isolation (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Biceps with advanced techniques — 3 sets of 8-12 reps @ RPE 9

exercises.name: Barbell Curls

intensity.description: Heavy, strict form — no swinging

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, after hitting 8-10 reps → drop weight 30% → immediately pump out another 8-10 reps (DROP SET). Expect massive biceps pump. Focus: Elbows stationary, no swinging, strict form even when fatigued.

exercises.name: Hammer Curls

intensity.description: Brachialis work — complements barbell curls

exercises.notes: Focus: Neutral grip, curl without rotating wrists. Go heavy—near failure on all sets. Builds forearm and upper arm thickness.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Stretching and recovery

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Lat stretch (hang from bar or doorway), biceps stretch, forearm stretch, light lower back stretch — hold each 30s. Back should feel pumped and fatigued.

metadata.title: Intermediate Week 13 — Wednesday (Day 3) INTENSIFICATION
keyFeatures: Slow eccentrics (4-5sec) on Bulgarian split squats

structuredWorkout.title: Legs: Quad Emphasis (INTENSIFICATION)
structuredWorkout.description: Peak intensification week. Advanced techniques deployed: rest-pause on squats (neurally demanding—stay focused), slow eccentrics on Bulgarian split squats (this will light up your quads), drop set on leg extensions (expect significant burn). Legs should feel torched. Expect significant DOMS tomorrow.

sections.title: Warm-Up
sections.overview: Thorough prep for heavy squatting

exercises.name: Light Cardio

intensity.description: Bike is ideal — no impact, quad activation

exercises.notes: Get blood flowing to lower body

exercises.name: Hip Mobility
exercises.notes: Leg swings (front-to-back, side-to-side), hip circles — loosen hips for deep squats

exercises.name: Activation
exercises.notes: Bodyweight squats, glute bridges — activate quads and glutes before loading

exercises.name: Light Squat Warm-Up

intensity.description: Bar, 95lbs, 135lbs progression

exercises.notes: Prime squat pattern — work up gradually to working weight. Focus on depth and upright torso.

sections.title: Compounds (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Heavy squatting and leg pressing — 3-4 sets of 6-12 reps @ RPE 8-9

exercises.name: Barbell Back Squat

intensity.description: Heavy squats — neurally demanding, stay focused

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, hit 6 reps → rack bar → rest 20sec → squeeze 2-3 more reps (REST-PAUSE). This is neurally demanding—maintain perfect form. Don't collapse under the bar. Focus: Depth to parallel+, chest up, drive through heels. Track weight.

exercises.name: Leg Press

intensity.description: Heavy load, full ROM — control the descent, don't bounce at bottom

exercises.notes: Focus: Feet shoulder-width and high on platform, control descent to 90°, explode up. Push to near failure (1-2 reps left). Heavy weight.

exercises.name: Bulgarian Split Squat

intensity.description: Unilateral quad/glute work (each leg)

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, add 4-5sec eccentric (descent) on EVERY rep. This will light up your quads. You may need assistance for balance—that's okay. Focus: Front leg does the work, control the descent, drive through front heel.

sections.title: Isolation (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Quad and hamstring isolation with advanced techniques — 3-4 sets of 12-15 reps @ RPE 9

exercises.name: Leg Extensions

intensity.description: Quad isolation — control the eccentric, squeeze at top

exercises.notes: ⚡ ADVANCED TECHNIQUE: On final set, after hitting failure at 12-15 → drop weight 40% → IMMEDIATELY rep out another 10-12 (DROP SET for quad pump). Expect significant burn. Focus: Control descent (3sec), squeeze quads at full extension, no momentum.

exercises.name: Leg Curls

intensity.description: Hamstring isolation — squeeze at contraction

exercises.notes: Focus: Control the descent, squeeze hamstrings hard at contraction. Go to near failure (1-2 reps left). No drop set here—quads already torched.

sections.title: Accessories (INTENSIFICATION)
sections.overview: Hamstring and calf work — high intensity

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift

intensity.description: Hamstring stretch and load — control the eccentric, feel the tension

exercises.notes: Focus: Hip hinge, push hips back, feel hamstring stretch. Control descent (3sec), drive hips forward. Heavy weight—near failure.

exercises.name: Calf Raises

intensity.description: Heavy weight, full ROM — calves respond to high intensity

exercises.notes: Focus: Full stretch at bottom (heel drop below toes), full contraction at top (plantarflexion), pause 1sec at top. Heavy weight, go to near failure.

sections.title: Cooldown
sections.overview: Stretching and recovery — legs will be FRIED

exercises.name: Static Stretching
exercises.notes: Quad stretch (pull foot to glute), hamstring stretch (toe touch), hip flexor stretch (lunge), calf stretch — hold each 30s per side. Legs should feel torched. Expect significant DOMS tomorrow.
